page.title: 01THE LOCAL TOWN
page.content: Maldon has a long interesting hist- ory and was mentioned in the original Domesday book.The centre of the town is still at the top of the hill where the first settlement was started.Today it's a busy,thriving town which is ex- panding all the time with new housing estates and businesses.Many buildings are very old,some dating back to the fourteenth century. One of the main features is the Riv- er Blackwater to which Maldon owes much of its early importance.The river is now used both commercially and for recreation. Maldon has kept its character desp- ite changes over the past 20 years- notably an increase in traffic.The proposed by-pass in 1987 will help preserve ancient buildings by removing heavy juggernauts which constantly rumble through the narrow streets.
